title: The Weeknd And Daft Punk Channel 1950s Sci-Fi In Intergalactic "I Feel It Coming" Video
text:
Error loading track please try again later or try a different track The Weeknd and Daft Punk Channel 1950s Sci-Fi in Intergalactic "I Feel It Coming" Video March 10, 2017 By THUMP Canada Staff After performing together at the Grammys last month, the Weeknd has shared the Warren Fu-directed music video for his chart-topping Daft Punk collaboration, "I Feel It Coming," off his 2016 album Starboy.Set on a planet straight out of a 1950s sci-fi film, the clip finds the Canadian R&B star si... Show More 
After performing together at the Grammys last month, the Weeknd has shared the Warren Fu-directed music video for his chart-topping Daft Punk collaboration, "I Feel It Coming," off his 2016 album Starboy . 
Set on a planet straight out of a 1950s sci-fi film, the clip finds the Canadian R&B star singing alone in the middle of a mountainous landscape, before dancing with a woman (played by US actor and model Kiko Mizuhara) who meets a stoney fate. A cloaked Thomas Bangalter and Guy-Manuel de Homem-Christo show up towards the end, trudging through a snowstorm where they discover a mysterious purple light. 
Watch it above and find out why THUMP named "I Feel It Coming" one of our favourite tracks of last year . Show Less
